docs.title: README
docs.text:
Info

You may have been redirected here from the api site. Any requests to the root directory or any 404 responses will instead redirect to this page, the docs.

This is the docs for my backend server running on vercel.

docs.title: about
docs.text:
faretek-api is a sever running flask which is deployed on Vercel.

Verifying the source code

If you are not confident that the vercel instance is running the exact same code as the GitHub repository, I've made the source open from Vercel so that you can verify it (if you know of a better way of doing this, do tell).

docs.title: Getting the deployment details
docs.text:
This gives the url of this commit, and some other information like the build logs.

  1. Navigate to the GitHub repo.
  2. Click the tick next to the latest commit (If you want to verify an older instance, you can do that too).
  3. Goto the link Details next to the Vercel Deployment check.

docs.title: Viewing source
docs.text:
If you want to view the source code, you can click the Source tab at the top of the page.

Or if the previous page resulted in an error:

  1. Append /source to the end of the Details url and press enter.
  2. You should be able to see the source code. It should be identical to the GitHub repository at the latest commit.

docs.title: README
docs.text:
This is the api section of faretek-api. This hosts endpoints that serve various purposes.

Every url in the api starts with https://faretek-api.vercel.app/api/

docs.title: If you have suggestions for what could be included in this markdown file, please raise an issue on GitHub
sb2gs
docs.text: sb2gs is a decompiler for goboscript. The original source code can be found here, however this API uses a modified version running on Python 3.12 so it can run on vercel. The whl file is accessible here.

docs.title: GET /?id=885002848
docs.text: Decompile a project with sb2gs, and return it as a zip file.
